intro: Encelia pringlei, commonly known as the coastal goldenbush, is a shrub native to the coastal regions of California and Baja California. It is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. The plant has silver-gray foliage with hairy leaves that help reduce water loss in arid conditions. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal dunes and scrub habitats. Encelia pringlei plays an important role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for native wildlife.
